storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive real-time alerts for scheduling conflicts to act promptly

testCases.title: Verify alert delivery within 5 seconds
preconditions: User is logged in as Scheduler
Alert notification system is operational
At least one notification channel is configured for the user
Conflict detection engine is running
Test environment has accurate time synchronization

steps.action: Create a scheduling conflict by booking the same resource for overlapping time slots
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling conflict is detected by the system and logged in conflict detection engine

steps.action: Start timer immediately after conflict is created
steps.expectedResult: Timer starts recording alert delivery time

steps.action: Monitor all configured notification channels (in-app, email, SMS) for alert delivery
steps.expectedResult: Alert is received on at least one configured channel

steps.action: Stop timer when alert is received and record the delivery time
steps.expectedResult: Alert delivery time is recorded and is less than or equal to 5 seconds from conflict creation

steps.action: Verify alert delivery confirmation in system logs
steps.expectedResult: System logs show successful alert delivery with timestamp within 5 seconds

postconditions: Alert is successfully delivered to Scheduler
Alert delivery time is logged in the system
Alert appears in user's active notifications
Conflict remains unresolved and visible in the system

testCases.title: Validate alert content and user acknowledgment
preconditions: User is logged in as Scheduler
A scheduling conflict has been created and detected
Alert has been delivered to the user
User has access to notification interface

steps.action: Open the received alert notification
steps.expectedResult: Alert notification opens and displays full content

steps.action: Review alert content for conflict details including resource name, conflicting time slots, and affected bookings
steps.expectedResult: Alert contains detailed conflict information: resource identifier, date/time of conflict, booking IDs involved, and conflict type

steps.action: Verify alert includes actionable information such as links to affected bookings
steps.expectedResult: Alert provides clickable links or references to navigate to conflict details

steps.action: Click the 'Acknowledge' button on the alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert status changes to 'Acknowledged' and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Click the 'Dismiss' button to remove alert from active notifications
steps.expectedResult: Alert is removed from active notifications list

steps.action: Navigate to alert history to verify dismissed alert is recorded
steps.expectedResult: Dismissed alert appears in alert history with 'Acknowledged' and 'Dismissed' status and timestamp

postconditions: Alert status is updated to acknowledged and dismissed
Alert is removed from active notifications
Alert is preserved in alert history
User action is logged with timestamp

testCases.title: Test user alert preference configuration
preconditions: User is logged in as Scheduler
User has access to alert preferences settings
Multiple notification channels are available (in-app, email, SMS)
User profile is fully configured with contact information

steps.action: Navigate to user profile or settings page
steps.expectedResult: Settings page loads successfully with alert preferences section visible

steps.action: Locate alert preferences configuration section
steps.expectedResult: Alert preferences section displays all available notification channels with toggle options

steps.action: Select specific notification channels (e.g., enable in-app and email, disable SMS)
steps.expectedResult: Selected channels are highlighted/checked, unselected channels are unchecked

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Update Preferences' button
steps.expectedResult: Success message displays confirming preferences have been saved

steps.action: Refresh the page and verify saved preferences persist
steps.expectedResult: Previously selected notification channels remain checked after page refresh

steps.action: Trigger a scheduling conflict to test alert delivery
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling conflict is created and detected by the system

steps.action: Monitor all notification channels for alert delivery
steps.expectedResult: Alert is received only via configured channels (in-app and email), no alert received via disabled channels (SMS)

steps.action: Verify no alerts are sent to disabled notification channels
steps.expectedResult: SMS channel shows no alert received, confirming preference configuration is respected

postconditions: User alert preferences are saved in the system
Alerts are delivered only through configured channels
Disabled channels do not receive alerts
User preferences are persisted for future alerts

storyTitle: As Resource Manager, I want to receive alerts for double bookings to resolve conflicts quickly

testCases.title: Verify alert delivery to Resource Manager within 5 seconds
preconditions: User is logged in as Resource Manager
Alert notification system is operational
At least one notification channel is configured for Resource Manager
Conflict detection engine is running and monitoring bookings
Test environment has accurate time synchronization
Resources are available for booking

steps.action: Create a double booking conflict by booking the same resource for the same time slot twice
steps.expectedResult: Double booking conflict is created and detected by the conflict detection engine

steps.action: Start timer immediately upon double booking creation
steps.expectedResult: Timer begins tracking alert delivery time from moment of conflict detection

steps.action: Monitor configured notification channels for Resource Manager (in-app, email, SMS)
steps.expectedResult: System processes the conflict and initiates alert generation

steps.action: Check for alert arrival on any configured notification channel
steps.expectedResult: Alert is received by Resource Manager on at least one configured channel

steps.action: Stop timer when alert is received and calculate delivery time
steps.expectedResult: Alert delivery time is 5 seconds or less from the moment of double booking detection

steps.action: Verify alert delivery confirmation in system logs via GET /alerts/status endpoint
steps.expectedResult: System logs confirm successful alert delivery with timestamp showing delivery within 5 seconds

postconditions: Alert is successfully delivered to Resource Manager
Alert delivery time meets performance requirement of under 5 seconds
Alert appears in Resource Manager's active notifications
Double booking conflict remains active and unresolved
Alert delivery is logged in system audit trail

testCases.title: Validate alert content and acknowledgment by Resource Manager
preconditions: User is logged in as Resource Manager
A double booking conflict has been created and detected
Alert has been delivered to Resource Manager
Resource Manager has access to notification interface
Alert history feature is enabled

steps.action: Locate and open the received double booking alert notification
steps.expectedResult: Alert notification opens displaying full alert details

steps.action: Review alert content for detailed conflict information including resource name, booking IDs, time slots, and parties involved
steps.expectedResult: Alert displays comprehensive conflict information: resource identifier, both booking IDs, conflicting date/time range, requestor names, and conflict severity

steps.action: Verify alert includes actionable elements such as links to booking details and resolution options
steps.expectedResult: Alert contains clickable links to view each conflicting booking and options to initiate resolution workflow

steps.action: Click the 'Acknowledge' button on the alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert status updates to 'Acknowledged', acknowledgment timestamp is recorded, and confirmation message appears

steps.action: Click the 'Dismiss' button to remove alert from active view
steps.expectedResult: Alert is removed from active notifications list and user receives confirmation of dismissal

steps.action: Navigate to alert history section to verify the dismissed alert is preserved
steps.expectedResult: Alert appears in alert history with complete details, 'Acknowledged' status, dismissal timestamp, and Resource Manager's user ID

steps.action: Verify alert history entry is accessible and searchable
steps.expectedResult: Alert can be retrieved from history using filters such as date, resource, or conflict type

postconditions: Alert status is updated to acknowledged and dismissed in the system
Alert is removed from active notifications for Resource Manager
Alert is permanently stored in alert history with full audit trail
Resource Manager's acknowledgment action is logged with timestamp
Double booking conflict remains visible in conflict management interface for resolution

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive conflict alerts via email to stay informed when away from the system

testCases.title: Verify email alert delivery within 5 seconds
preconditions: User account is active and configured in the system
User has valid email address registered in profile
Email alert preferences are enabled for the user
Email server is operational and accessible
Conflict detection engine is running
User is logged into the system with scheduler role

steps.action: Create a scheduling conflict by assigning the same resource to two overlapping time slots
steps.expectedResult: System detects the scheduling conflict and triggers conflict detection engine

steps.action: Note the exact timestamp when the conflict was created
steps.expectedResult: Timestamp is recorded for delivery time calculation

steps.action: Monitor the email inbox associated with the user account
steps.expectedResult: Email alert is received in the inbox

steps.action: Check the received timestamp of the email alert
steps.expectedResult: Email alert is received within 5 seconds of the conflict creation timestamp

steps.action: Verify the email sender and subject line
steps.expectedResult: Email is from the system notification address with subject indicating scheduling conflict

postconditions: Email alert is successfully delivered to user inbox
Conflict remains active in the system until resolved
Email delivery status is logged in the system
User can access the email for conflict details

testCases.title: Validate email alert content and formatting
preconditions: User has received a conflict alert email in their inbox
Email client is accessible (desktop or mobile)
Conflict details are available in the system
Email alert preferences are enabled

steps.action: Open the received conflict alert email in desktop email client
steps.expectedResult: Email opens successfully and displays content properly formatted

steps.action: Verify email contains conflict type information
steps.expectedResult: Email clearly displays the type of scheduling conflict (e.g., resource overlap, time conflict)

steps.action: Verify email contains affected resources details
steps.expectedResult: Email lists all resources involved in the conflict with their identifiers

steps.action: Verify email contains time and date information
steps.expectedResult: Email displays the conflicting time slots with dates in readable format

steps.action: Verify email contains actionable links or instructions
steps.expectedResult: Email includes link to view conflict in system or instructions to resolve

steps.action: Open the same email on a mobile device
steps.expectedResult: Email is responsive and displays all information clearly on mobile screen without horizontal scrolling

steps.action: Verify all text is readable and images/icons render correctly on mobile
steps.expectedResult: Content is properly formatted for mobile viewing with appropriate font sizes and spacing

postconditions: Email content is verified as complete and accurate
Email formatting is confirmed for both desktop and mobile
User has clear understanding of the conflict from email alone

testCases.title: Test user preference changes for email alerts
preconditions: User is logged into the system with scheduler role
User has access to preferences/settings page
Email alert feature is available in the system
User currently has email alerts enabled

steps.action: Navigate to user preferences or settings page
steps.expectedResult: Preferences page loads successfully displaying notification settings

steps.action: Locate the email alerts toggle or checkbox for conflict notifications
steps.expectedResult: Email alert preference control is visible and currently enabled/checked

steps.action: Disable email alerts by unchecking the option or toggling it off
steps.expectedResult: Toggle switches to disabled state with visual confirmation

steps.action: Click Save or Apply button to save preferences
steps.expectedResult: System displays success message confirming preference has been saved

steps.action: Refresh the preferences page or navigate away and return
steps.expectedResult: Email alert preference remains disabled, confirming persistence

steps.action: Create a scheduling conflict by assigning overlapping resources
steps.expectedResult: System detects and displays the conflict in the UI

steps.action: Wait for 10 seconds and check the user's email inbox
steps.expectedResult: No email alert is received for the conflict

steps.action: Verify in-app notification is still displayed
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alert appears in the system UI, confirming only email is disabled

postconditions: Email alerts remain disabled for the user
User preference is saved in the database
No email alerts are sent for subsequent conflicts
In-app notifications continue to function normally

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to acknowledge and dismiss conflict alerts to manage notifications effectively

testCases.title: Verify alert acknowledgment functionality
preconditions: User is logged into the system with scheduler role
At least one active conflict alert exists in the system
Alert is displayed in the active notifications list
User has permission to acknowledge alerts
Alert management UI is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the notifications or alerts section of the application
steps.expectedResult: Alerts page loads displaying list of active conflict alerts

steps.action: Identify and view the conflict alert in the active alerts list
steps.expectedResult: Alert is displayed with conflict details, timestamp, and available actions

steps.action: Note the current count of active alerts displayed
steps.expectedResult: Active alert count is visible (e.g., '5 active alerts')

steps.action: Click or tap the 'Acknowledge' button for the selected alert
steps.expectedResult: System processes the acknowledgment request and provides visual feedback (e.g., loading indicator)

steps.action: Verify the alert status changes to 'Acknowledged'
steps.expectedResult: Alert status is updated and displayed as 'Acknowledged' with timestamp

steps.action: Check the active alerts list
steps.expectedResult: Alert is removed from the active alerts list and active count decreases by one

steps.action: Navigate to acknowledged or archived alerts section
steps.expectedResult: Previously acknowledged alert appears in the acknowledged alerts list

steps.action: Verify the acknowledgment timestamp and user information
steps.expectedResult: Alert shows who acknowledged it and when, with accurate timestamp

postconditions: Alert status is permanently updated to 'Acknowledged' in database
Alert is removed from active notifications
Alert appears in acknowledged alerts history
Active alert count is decremented
User action is logged in audit trail

testCases.title: Verify alert dismissal with authorization
preconditions: Two user accounts exist: one with dismissal authorization and one without
At least one active conflict alert exists in the system
Both users have access to view alerts
Authorization rules are configured for alert dismissal
Alert management system is operational

steps.action: Log into the system as a user with authorized dismissal permissions (e.g., Senior Scheduler or Admin)
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs in and has access to alert management

steps.action: Navigate to the active alerts list and select a conflict alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert details are displayed with 'Dismiss' button visible and enabled

steps.action: Click the 'Dismiss' button for the selected alert
steps.expectedResult: System prompts for confirmation of dismissal action

steps.action: Confirm the dismissal action
steps.expectedResult: Alert is dismissed successfully with confirmation message displayed

steps.action: Verify the alert is removed from active alerts list
steps.expectedResult: Alert no longer appears in active alerts and is moved to dismissed alerts history

steps.action: Log out and log in as a user without dismissal authorization (e.g., Junior Scheduler or Viewer role)
steps.expectedResult: Unauthorized user successfully logs in with limited permissions

steps.action: Navigate to the active alerts list and select a conflict alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert details are displayed but 'Dismiss' button is either hidden, disabled, or grayed out

steps.action: Attempt to dismiss the alert (if button is visible, click it; otherwise try API call or direct URL)
steps.expectedResult: System prevents dismissal and displays error message: 'You do not have permission to dismiss alerts' or similar

steps.action: Verify the alert remains in the active alerts list
steps.expectedResult: Alert status is unchanged and remains active in the system

steps.action: Check system logs for the unauthorized dismissal attempt
steps.expectedResult: Unauthorized attempt is logged with user ID, timestamp, and action denied

postconditions: Authorized user successfully dismissed alert is recorded in history
Unauthorized user's alert remains active and unchanged
Security event is logged for unauthorized attempt
Permission controls are validated as functioning correctly
Alert dismissal authorization rules are enforced

testCases.title: Ensure alert history logs actions
preconditions: User is logged into the system with scheduler role
At least one active conflict alert exists
Alert history feature is enabled and accessible
User has permission to acknowledge or dismiss alerts
Audit logging is enabled in the system

steps.action: Navigate to the active alerts section and select a conflict alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert details are displayed with available actions (Acknowledge/Dismiss)

steps.action: Note the alert ID and current timestamp before taking action
steps.expectedResult: Alert ID and timestamp are recorded for verification

steps.action: Click 'Acknowledge' button for the selected alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert is acknowledged successfully with confirmation message

steps.action: Navigate to the alert history or audit log section
steps.expectedResult: Alert history page loads displaying chronological list of alert actions

steps.action: Search or filter for the acknowledged alert by alert ID
steps.expectedResult: Alert history entry is found showing the acknowledgment action

steps.action: Verify the history entry contains: alert ID, action type (Acknowledged), user who performed action, and timestamp
steps.expectedResult: All required information is present and accurate in the history log

steps.action: Create or select another active conflict alert
steps.expectedResult: New alert is available for testing dismissal action

steps.action: Dismiss the alert using the 'Dismiss' button
steps.expectedResult: Alert is dismissed successfully with confirmation

steps.action: Return to alert history and search for the dismissed alert
steps.expectedResult: History entry for dismissal action is found

steps.action: Verify the dismissal entry contains: alert ID, action type (Dismissed), user who performed action, timestamp, and any dismissal reason if provided
steps.expectedResult: Complete dismissal information is logged accurately in alert history

steps.action: Verify both actions appear in chronological order in the history
steps.expectedResult: Alert history displays both acknowledgment and dismissal actions in correct sequence with proper timestamps

postconditions: All alert actions are permanently recorded in alert history
Audit trail is complete and accurate for compliance
History entries are searchable and filterable
User actions are traceable for accountability
System maintains data integrity of alert action logs

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to configure alert preferences to receive notifications relevant to my role

testCases.title: Verify alert preference modification and persistence
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler
User has valid authentication credentials
Alert preference settings page is accessible
User profile database is operational
At least one alert channel is available (in-app, email, or SMS)
Default alert preferences are currently set

steps.action: Navigate to user profile or settings menu
steps.expectedResult: User profile or settings menu is displayed with navigation options

steps.action: Click on 'Alert Preferences' or 'Notification Settings' option
steps.expectedResult: Alert preference settings UI is displayed showing current preference configuration including alert types, channels, and frequency options

steps.action: Review current alert type settings (conflicts, reminders)
steps.expectedResult: Current alert type selections are visible with checkboxes or toggle switches showing enabled/disabled state

steps.action: Select or deselect desired alert types (e.g., enable 'Conflicts', disable 'Reminders')
steps.expectedResult: Alert type selections update visually to reflect the changes made

steps.action: Change alert channel from current setting to a different option (e.g., from 'In-app only' to 'Email and In-app')
steps.expectedResult: Selected channels are highlighted or checked, showing the new channel configuration

steps.action: Modify frequency setting (e.g., change from 'Immediate' to 'Daily digest')
steps.expectedResult: Frequency dropdown or radio button updates to show the newly selected frequency option

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Apply' button to save preferences
steps.expectedResult: System displays success message confirming preferences have been saved successfully

steps.action: Navigate away from the alert preferences page and return to it
steps.expectedResult: Previously saved preferences are displayed correctly, confirming persistence across navigation

steps.action: Create or trigger a test alert condition that matches the configured alert type (e.g., create a scheduling conflict)
steps.expectedResult: Alert is generated in the system

steps.action: Verify alert delivery through the configured channels
steps.expectedResult: Alert is delivered only through the selected channels (e.g., email and in-app) and not through unselected channels (e.g., SMS)

steps.action: Check alert delivery timing matches the configured frequency
steps.expectedResult: If 'Immediate' was selected, alert is delivered instantly; if 'Daily digest' was selected, alert is queued for digest delivery

steps.action: Log out and log back in to the system
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs back in

steps.action: Access alert preferences settings again
steps.expectedResult: All previously configured preferences are retained and displayed correctly, confirming persistence across sessions

postconditions: User alert preferences are saved in the user profile database
Alert delivery system is configured according to user preferences
Preferences persist across sessions and page navigation
Future alerts will be delivered according to the updated preferences
System logs reflect the preference changes

testCases.title: Validate preference input validation
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler
User has access to alert preference settings
Alert preference settings page is accessible
Validation rules are configured in the system
API endpoints for preference validation are operational

steps.action: Navigate to alert preferences settings page
steps.expectedResult: Alert preference settings UI is displayed with all configuration options

steps.action: Attempt to deselect all alert types (no conflicts, no reminders)
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error message indicating at least one alert type must be selected, or allows the selection but warns user

steps.action: Attempt to deselect all alert channels (no in-app, no email, no SMS)
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error message: 'At least one alert channel must be selected' and prevents saving

steps.action: Select SMS channel and enter an invalid phone number format (e.g., 'abc123' or incomplete number)
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error: 'Invalid phone number format. Please enter a valid phone number' and highlights the invalid field

steps.action: Select email channel and enter an invalid email address (e.g., 'invalidemail' or 'test@')
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error: 'Invalid email address format. Please enter a valid email' and highlights the invalid field

steps.action: Attempt to select a frequency option that is not supported (if applicable through API manipulation or direct input)
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error: 'Invalid frequency option selected' and resets to a valid default option

steps.action: Try to save preferences with validation errors present
steps.expectedResult: System prevents saving and displays message: 'Please correct the errors before saving preferences' with all validation errors listed

steps.action: Correct one validation error but leave others unresolved
steps.expectedResult: System still prevents saving and continues to display remaining validation errors

steps.action: Correct all validation errors with valid inputs
steps.expectedResult: Validation error messages disappear and fields are marked as valid

steps.action: Click 'Save' button with all valid inputs
steps.expectedResult: System successfully saves preferences and displays success confirmation message

steps.action: Attempt to submit preferences using API with invalid JSON payload or missing required fields
steps.expectedResult: API returns appropriate error response (400 Bad Request) with detailed validation error messages

steps.action: Verify that invalid preferences were not saved to the database
steps.expectedResult: Previous valid preferences remain unchanged in the system; no invalid data is persisted

postconditions: Invalid preferences are not saved to the database
User is informed of all validation errors clearly
System maintains data integrity by rejecting invalid inputs
Previous valid preferences remain intact
Validation error messages are cleared once errors are corrected
System logs validation failures for audit purposes
